ISSUE.TITLE: Can't `podman volume create` a tmpfs volume with size limit
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Description I wanted to create a tmpfs volume with size limit to mount in a container, but it throws an error that it is unsupported, but I believe it should be, according to [discussion 20442](https://github.com/containers/podman/discussions/20442). Initially hit on 4.7.0 and also tried on 4.7.1 with the same results. ### Steps to reproduce the issue ```bash → podman volume create --opt type=tmpfs --opt device=tmpfs --opt o=size=1M mytmp Error: volume options size and inodes not supported. Filesystem does not support Project Quota ``` ### Describe the results you received Error: volume options size and inodes not supported. Filesystem does not support Project Quota ### Describe the results you expected I expected the volume creation to succeed because tmpfs supports size limit when used in a `run` command like: ```bash → podman run --rm --mount=type=tmpfs,tmpfs-size=1M,destination=/out fedora bash -c 'yes > /out/foo' yes: standard output: No space left on device ``` ### podman info output ```yaml host: arch: amd64 buildahVersion: 1.32.0 cgroupControllers: - cpu - io - memory - pids cgroupManager: systemd cgroupVersion: v2 conmon: package: conmon-2.1.7-2.fc38.x86_64 path: /usr/bin/conmon version: 'conmon version 2.1.7, commit: ' databaseBackend: boltdb distribution: distribution: fedora variant: workstation version: "38" eventLogger: journald freeLocks: 2025 hostname: ahostname idMappings: gidmap: - container_id: 0 host_id: 1000 size: 1 - container_id: 1 host_id: 100000 size: 65536 uidmap: - container_id: 0 host_id: 1000 size: 1 - container_id: 1 host_id: 100000 size: 65536 kernel: 6.4.13-200.fc38.x86_64 linkmode: dynamic logDriver: journald memFree: 66502529024 memTotal: 134958149632 networkBackend: netavark networkBackendInfo: backend: netavark dns: package: aardvark-dns-1.8.0-1.fc38.x86_64 path: /usr/libexec/podman/aardvark-dns version: aardvark-dns 1.8.0 package: netavark-1.8.0-2.fc38.x86_64 path: /usr/libexec/podman/netavark version: netavark 1.8.0 ociRuntime: name: crun package: crun-1.9.2-1.fc38.x86_64 path: /usr/bin/crun version: |- crun version 1.9.2 commit: 35274d346d2e9ffeacb22cc11590b0266a23d634 rundir: /run/user/1000/crun spec: 1.0.0 +SYSTEMD +SELINUX +APPARMOR +CAP +SECCOMP +EBPF +CRIU +LIBKRUN +WASM:wasmedge +YAJL os: linux pasta: executable: /usr/bin/pasta package: passt-0^20231004.gf851084-1.fc38.x86_64 version: | pasta 0^20231004.gf851084-1.fc38.x86_64 Copyright Red Hat GNU General Public License, version 2 or later <https://www.gnu.org/licenses/old-licenses/gpl-2.0.html> This is free software: you are free to change and redistribute it.
